meanings.sent1: She duped her friend into believing a fake story.
meanings.sent2: The con artist duped many people with his scams.
meanings.sent3: The magician duped the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The clever fox duped the hunters by leading them in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent5: The tricky salesman duped customers into buying unnecessary products.

meanings.definition: A person who has been deceived or tricked
meanings.sent1: He felt like a dupe after realizing he had been tricked.
meanings.sent2: The dupe was embarrassed when he found out the truth.
meanings.sent3: The poor dupe fell for the same prank twice in a row.
meanings.sent4: She didn't want to be seen as a dupe, so she double-checked everything.
meanings.sent5: The dupe learned to be more cautious after being deceived before.
